history.content:
According to this notice: http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/notices.html#cory-down you should use one of:

	ashby.cs.berkeley.edu
	cedar.cs.berkeley.edu
	derby.cs.berkeley.edu
	gilman.cs.berkeley.edu
	heasrt.cs.berkeley.edu
	oxford.cs.berkeley.edu
	solano.cs.berkeley.edu
	ward.cs.berkeley.edu

children.subject:
I still can't run the mkhometmpdir executable from these computers, it gives a message requesting that you run it on a Sun Solaris system. But according to http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/cgi-bin/clients.cgi?choice=servers , the only Solaris machine is cory.eecs.berkeley.edu, which is getting converted to Linux.

Is there another way to set up a /home/tmp folder that anyone knows of?

history.content: I want to connect to a solaris machine to set up my /home/tmp directory. However, when I try to ssh into cory.eecs.berkeley.edu using my cs184 account, it always fails with the message " ssh: connect to host cory.eecs.berkeley.edu port 22: No route to host ". Does anyone know of a different solaris machine I can try or a different method to get access to a /home/tmp folder?
history.subject: Cannot connect to cory.eecs.berkeley.edu
